prototype

Class Board

  • java.lang.Object
    • java.util.Observable
      • prototype.Board

  • public class Board
extends java.util.Observable
    The Board class is used to create the board and hold the logic that is used to play checkers.
    Version:
    stable build 17 April 2018
    Author:
    Gionata Bonazzi, Cole Sellers, Brendan Cronan, Rosa Fleming

      Creates a instance of the board set to the size of the board.
      static int SIZE
      The final SIZE of the board is 8x8.

    • Method Detail

      • init

        private void init()
        initializes the board to 8x8 setting the rows and columns. it then sets the colorStatus of each specific tile to either White, Black, or empty.

      • getBoard

        public ColorStatus[][] getBoard()
        Gets the current state of the board.
        Returns:
        The current state of the board.

      • move

        public boolean move(Player player,
                    int ir,
                    int ic,
                    int fr,
                    int fc)
        Constructor of the board class, it takes in an Object of the game abd adds an observer of and initialize the board.
        Parameters:
        player - A instance of the player class.
        ir - The initial row of the piece
        ic - The initial column of the piece
        fr - The final row of the piece after move
        fc - The final column of the piece after move.
        Returns:
        if the player has made a jump

        public boolean canMove(int fr,
                       int fc)
        A boolean method that checks if the final position is a move.
        Parameters:
        fr - The row the piece moves from
        fc - The column the pece moves from. return true if the piece can move or false if it cannot move.
        Returns:
        board

      • canMove

        public boolean canMove(ColorStatus player,
                       ColorStatus king,
                       int r,
                       int c)
        A boolean method that checks if the piece can move in any direction.
        Parameters:
        player - A instance of the ColorStatus that gets the color of the player.
        king - A instance of ColorStatus that checks if the player is a king.
        r - Gets the row of the piece.
        c - Gets the column of the piece.
        Returns:
        True if the piece can move or false if the piece can not.

      • setAllFalse

        public boolean[][] setAllFalse()
        Sets all the tiles to false.
        Returns:
        the results of setting all the tiles to false.

      • showDoubleJumpOptions

        public boolean[][] showDoubleJumpOptions(Player player,
                                         int row,
                                         int col)
        Returns true if the index is outside of the boundaries of the game.
        Parameters:
        player - A instance of the Player Object
        row - The row of the piece that is being hecked if a double jump is possible
        col - The column of the piece that is being hecked if a double jump is possible
        Returns:
        true if there is a double jump or false if there is not

      • showOptions

        public boolean[][] showOptions(Player player,
                               int row,
                               int col)
        A boolean method that Shows the player whose turn it is the current pieces that can be moved that turn.
        Parameters:
        player - Passes an instance of Player
        row - The row of the piece
        col - The Column of the piece
        Returns:
        true or false depending on if the piece at specific row and column has a has a move.

      • canJump

        private boolean canJump(ColorStatus player,
                        ColorStatus king,
                        int ir,
                        int ic,
                        int fr,
                        int fc)
        A boolean method in which determines if the piece can jump another piece.
        Parameters:
        player - A instance of the Player object
        king - Checks if the piece is a king or not
        ir - The initial row of the jumping piece
        ic - The initial column of the jumping piece
        fr - The final row of the jumping piece
        fc - The final column of thw jumping piece.
        Returns:
        true if a player can jump or false if a player can not jump.

      • checkBoard

        private boolean checkBoard(ColorStatus checker,
                           ColorStatus king)
        Checks the board to see if team still has checkers.
        Parameters:
        checker - checks the color of the checker.
        king - Checks if the piece is a king or not
        Returns:
        false if there is no piece and true if there is

      • checkBounds

        private boolean checkBounds(int num1)
        Returns true if the index is outside of the boundaries of the game.
        Parameters:
        num1 - Checks if the number is out of the bounds of the board
        Returns:
        true if it is out of bounds or false if it is not.
